kw.name: Connect To Database
kw.doc: Loads the DB API 2.0 module given `dbapiModuleName` then uses it to connect to the database using `dbName`, `dbUsername`, and `dbPassword`.
kw.msg: Connecting using : pymssql.connect(database=AdventureWorks2012, user=roboto, password=roboto123, host=192.168.0.185, port=1433)

kw.name: Row Count Is Equal To X
kw.doc: Check if the number of rows returned from `selectStatement` is equal to the value submitted. If not, then this will throw an AssertionError. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback.
kw.msg: Executing : Row Count Is Equal To X | SELECT * FROM [AdventureWorks2012].[Person].[Address]; | 19614

test.name: get count unique StateProvinceID values

kw.name: Get Count
kw.doc: Returns and logs how many times ``item`` is found from ``container``.

test.doc: | | TC2. Verify uniquness of StateProvinceID column |

test.name: get count Not Null AddresLine2 values

kw.name: Get Count
kw.arg: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM [AdventureWorks2012].[Person].[Address] WHERE AddressLine2 is not null;
kw.doc: Returns and logs how many times ``item`` is found from ``container``.

test.doc: | | TC3. Verify count of not null AddressLine2 |

test.name: ModifiedDate in the future

kw.name: Get Count
kw.arg: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM [AdventureWorks2012].[Person].[Address] WHERE ModifiedDate > GETDATE();
kw.doc: Returns and logs how many times ``item`` is found from ``container``.

test.doc: | | TC4. Check that no exist ModifiedDate in the future |

test.name: Max lenght of DocumentSummary

kw.name: Length Should Be
kw.doc: Verifies that the length of the given item is correct.

test.doc: | | TC5. Check MAX length of the DocumentSummary column |

test.name: Flag value not in range

kw.name: Get Count
kw.arg: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM [AdventureWorks2012].[Production].[Document] WHERE FolderFlag NOT IN (0,1);
kw.doc: Returns and logs how many times ``item`` is found from ``container``.

test.doc: | | TC6. Check the FolderFlag column values in the valid range |

test.name: Count unique values

kw.name: Execute Sql String
kw.arg: SELECT CASE WHEN COUNT(distinct UnitMeasureCode) = COUNT(Distinct Name) THEN 'TRUE' ELSE 'FALSE' END FROM [AdventureWorks2012].[Production].[UnitMeasure];
kw.doc: Executes the sqlString as SQL commands. Useful to pass arguments to your sql. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback.
kw.msg: Executing : Execute SQL String | SELECT CASE WHEN COUNT(distinct UnitMeasureCode) = COUNT(Distinct Name) THEN 'TRUE' ELSE 'FALSE' END FROM [AdventureWorks2012].[Production].[UnitMeasure];

kw.name: Log
kw.doc: Logs the given message with the given level.

kw.name: Should Be Equal As Strings
kw.doc: Fails if objects are unequal after converting them to strings.

test.doc: | | TC7. Check the that measures are unique |

kw.name: Row Count Is Equal To X
kw.arg: SELECT [UnitMeasureCode],[Name],[ModifiedDate],COUNT(*) FROM [AdventureWorks2012].[Production].[UnitMeasure] GROUP BY [UnitMeasureCode],[Name],[ModifiedDate] HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;
kw.doc: Check if the number of rows returned from `selectStatement` is equal to the value submitted. If not, then this will throw an AssertionError. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback.
kw.msg: Executing : Row Count Is Equal To X | SELECT [UnitMeasureCode],[Name],[ModifiedDate],COUNT(*) FROM [AdventureWorks2012].[Production].[UnitMeasure] GROUP BY [UnitMeasureCode],[Name],[ModifiedDate] HAVING COUNT(*) > 1; | 0

Executing : Row Count | SELECT [UnitMeasureCode],[Name],[ModifiedDate],COUNT(*) FROM [AdventureWorks2012].[Production].[UnitMeasure] GROUP BY [UnitMeasureCode],[Name],[ModifiedDate] HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;
